thread.title_full: Warning over thousands of Bosch and Neff cookers that could have faulty gas supply and suddenly EXPLODE

author: Steve Robson
title: Warning over thousands of Bosch and Neff cookers that could have faulty gas supply and suddenly EXPLODE
text:
News Warning over thousands of Bosch and Neff cookers that could have faulty gas supply and suddenly EXPLODE Manufacturing giant BSH has admitted a problem with gas connectors which can lead to gas escaping "in an uncontrolled manner" Share Get daily   
Thousands of Brits are being warned to check their Bosch and Neff cookers "immediately" for a fault which could cause them to explode. 
The appliance giant has warned that two models of their cookers have been shown to have a fault affecting the gas supply. 
The company said: "Due to potential damage to installed gas connectors, in certain circumstances gas can escape in an uncontrolled manner and in extremely rare cases a risk of explosion can arise." 
Anyone who owns the Bosch model: NGU4151DB or Neff model: T20S31N0 are being warned to turn off the gas supply to the appliance immediately and do not use it again until it has been inspected by an expert. 
The models were produced between January 2009 and October 2011. Two models of Bosch and Neff cookers are affected (Photo: Bosch) 
It is believed there are almost 4,000 appliances potentially affected in the UK. 
BSH, the German manufacturing firm which makes the cookers, says every owner will get a free replacement of the gas connector by an authorised service engineer at their home. 
In a product safety notice, the firm added: "BSH requests all customers of a product listed above to check whether their appliance is affected by this safety campaign. 
"We apologise for any inconveniences caused and thank you for your understanding and patience. 
"Please call us in case you have problems with checking whether your appliance is affected or you have any further questions." For more information visit gascookingsafety.com Like us on Facebook
